# The `BasicTTIImplBase` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Base class which can be used to help build a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> implementation. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Base class which can be used to help build a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> implementation.

This class provides as much implementation of the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a> interface as is possible using the target independent parts of the code generator.

In order to subclass it, your class must implement a getST() method to return the subtarget, and a getTLI() method to return the target lowering. We need these methods implemented in the derived class so that this class doesn&#39;t have to duplicate storage for them.

Definition at line 80 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h">BasicTTIImpl.h</a>.

### isSplatMask() {#a1997f0a2782e3b875e27188e8231f065}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>static bool llvm::BasicTTIImplBase&lt; T &gt;::isSplatMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, unsigned NumSrcElts, int &amp; Index)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Checks if the provided mask <code>is</code> a splat mask, i.e.

it contains only -1 or same non -1 index value and this index value contained at least twice. So, mask &lt;0, -1,-1, -1&gt; is not considered splat (it is just identity), same for &lt;-1, 0, -1, -1&gt; (just a slide), while &lt;2, -1, 2, -1&gt; is a splat with <code>Index=2</code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h/#l00266">266</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h">BasicTTIImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getCallInstrCost {#aa9afd54ce2ef21c71a89f9c5d7df6a40}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>InstructionCost llvm::BasicTTIImplBase&lt; T &gt;::getCallInstrCost (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &#42; F, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; RetTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; &gt; Tys, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo/#a706f223f760b55668fbae74202b816bb">TTI::TargetCostKind</a> CostKind)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compute a cost of the given call instruction.

Compute the cost of calling function F with return type RetTy and argument types Tys. F might be nullptr, in this case the cost of an arbitrary call with the specified signature will be returned. This is used, for instance, when we estimate call of a vector counterpart of the given function. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="F">Called function, might be nullptr.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="RetTy">Return value types.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Tys"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/argument">Argument</a> types.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
The cost of Call instruction.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h/#l02690">2690</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h">BasicTTIImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getOrderedReductionCost {#a22615a6ebaa0232be4b70be555bf0690}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>InstructionCost llvm::BasicTTIImplBase&lt; T &gt;::getOrderedReductionCost (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype">VectorType</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo/#a706f223f760b55668fbae74202b816bb">TTI::TargetCostKind</a> CostKind)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Try to calculate the cost of performing strict (in-order) reductions, which involves doing a sequence of floating point additions in lane order, starting with an initial value.

For example, consider a scalar initial value &#39;InitVal&#39; of type float and a vector of type &lt;4 x float&gt;:

Vector = &lt;float v0, float v1, float v2, float v3&gt;

add1 = InitVal + v0 add2 = add1 + v1 add3 = add2 + v2 add4 = add3 + v3

As a simple estimate we can say the cost of such a reduction is 4 times the cost of a scalar FP addition. We can only estimate the costs for fixed-width vectors here because for scalable vectors we do not know the runtime number of operations.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h/#l02815">2815</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h">BasicTTIImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getTreeReductionCost {#a2c1b9368972e15e3602d4279f9988584}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>InstructionCost llvm::BasicTTIImplBase&lt; T &gt;::getTreeReductionCost (unsigned Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/vectortype">VectorType</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo/#a706f223f760b55668fbae74202b816bb">TTI::TargetCostKind</a> CostKind)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Try to calculate arithmetic and shuffle op costs for reduction intrinsics.

We&#39;re assuming that reduction operation are performing the following way:

val1 = shufflevector&lt;n x t&gt; val, &lt;n x t&gt; undef, &lt;n x i32&gt; &lt;i32 n/2, i32 n/2 + 1, ..., i32 n, i32 undef, ..., i32 undef&gt; -------------—v----------—/ -------—v---------—/ n/2 elements n/2 elements red1 = op &lt;n x t&gt; val, &lt;n x t&gt; val1 After this operation we have a vector red1 where only the first n/2 elements are meaningful, the second n/2 elements are undefined and can be dropped. All other operations are actually working with the vector of length n/2, not n, though the real vector length is still n. val2 = shufflevector&lt;n x t&gt; red1, &lt;n x t&gt; undef, &lt;n x i32&gt; &lt;i32 n/4, i32 n/4 + 1, ..., i32 n/2, i32 undef, ..., i32 undef&gt; -------------—v----------—/ -------—v---------—/ n/4 elements 3&#42;n/4 elements red2 = op &lt;n x t&gt; red1, &lt;n x t&gt; val2 - working with the vector of length n/2, the resulting vector has length n/4 etc.

The cost model should take into account that the actual length of the vector is reduced on each iteration.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h/#l02739">2739</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/basicttiimpl-h">BasicTTIImpl.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
